meanings.definition: The characteristic customs, habits, and traditions of urban areas.
meanings.sent1: The urbanisms of the city include bustling streets and tall buildings.
meanings.sent2: She studied the urbanisms of different cities to understand their unique cultures.
meanings.sent3: The urbanisms of the town were so modern that even the pigeons wore tiny suits.
meanings.sent4: His writing reflected the urbanisms of the city, with its fast-paced rhythm and diverse characters.
meanings.sent5: The artist captured the urbanisms of the metropolis in vibrant colors and bold shapes.

meanings.definition: The study or analysis of urban areas and their development.
meanings.sent1: Her research focused on urbanisms and how cities grow over time.
meanings.sent2: The professor's expertise in urbanisms made her lectures engaging and informative.
meanings.sent3: The students found urbanisms to be a fascinating subject, especially when they visited the city for fieldwork.
meanings.sent4: The book delved deep into the urbanisms of ancient civilizations, revealing surprising insights.
meanings.sent5: Through his work, he hoped to contribute to the understanding of urbanisms and city planning.

meanings.definition: The quality or style of being characteristic of urban areas.
meanings.sent1: The urbanisms of the neighborhood were evident in its vibrant street art and trendy cafes.
meanings.sent2: She admired the urbanisms of the city, appreciating its blend of old and new architecture.
meanings.sent3: The fashion designer drew inspiration from urbanisms, creating a collection that reflected city life.
meanings.sent4: His music captured the essence of urbanisms, with beats that echoed the rhythm of the streets.
meanings.sent5: The photographer's exhibition showcased the beauty of urbanisms through striking images of city landscapes.
